nodes.title: Babes-Bolyai University
nodes.body: Master's degree in Software Engineering at the faculty of Mathematics and Informatics (dissertation pending).

nodes.title: SAP Development Course
nodes.body: A series of lectures and laboratories hosted by msg which served as an introduction to the SAP world.

nodes.title: Technical University of Cluj-Napoca
nodes.body: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science at the faculty of Computer Science and Information Technology.

nodes.title: Leonardo da'Vinci Project
nodes.body: A month-and-a-half-long exchange project set in Leipzig, Germany. Studied basic web technologies like HTML, PHP and JS at a local company.

nodes.title: Gheorghe Lazar National College Sibiu
nodes.body: High school degree in Mathematics - Informatics. My first contact with programming. During this period, I've learnt C / C++, C# and PHP.

nodes.title: SVP of Software Engineering @ Trilogy (New Products)
nodes.body:
Built independent department from 6 to 30-40 people while scaling from 3 to 11 concurrent products, achieving 3x productivity improvement. Started as VP leading backend engineering team, promoted to SVP with expanded scope including design, product, and operations, managing $6M/year budget with full autonomy over team structure and processes.

Spearheaded AI adoption strategy during 2024, achieving productivity gains while industry-wide metrics declined. Built internal automation and productivity infrastructure (CI/CD pipelines, JIRA automations, dashboards). Shipped multiple greenfield products from concept to production as hands-on product manager, architect, and full-stack engineer, including TimeBack (Alpha School's AI tutoring platform enabling 99th percentile learning outcomes) and enhanced Trilogy Sales Platform (managing thousands of automated contract renewals across 200+ products).

nodes.title: VP of Software Engineering @ Trilogy (Central Engineering)
nodes.body:
Led team of 4 to 10-15 engineers (grown through internal transfers) operating and extending two acquired SaaS products: InsideSales Playbooks ($20M/year ARR sales engagement platform) and ResponseTek. Focus on operational excellence and large-scale modernization of existing products.

Reduced outages by 5x and cut cloud infrastructure costs in half. Led major modernization: telephony system migration from self-hosted to serverless (Twilio), cleared defect backlog, implemented new features while maintaining production stability.

nodes.title: Software Engineering Consultant @ msg-systems (Part-time, 1-2 hours/week)
nodes.body: I provide part-time technical consulting for cloud-native projects, making technical decisions and implementing challenging tasks for a SaaS product on AWS using Spring Boot and React. I also mentor and coach a group of high-potential developers.

nodes.title: Cloud Solutions Architect @ DevFactory
nodes.body: As an ivory-tower architect, wrote technical architecture specifications for a portfolio of over 200 products. Produced an average of 3 specifications per week, with implementation requiring hundreds of man-days by engineers. Expert in utilizing AWS serverless technologies (Lambda, Step Functions, DynamoDB, Cognito, etc.) and experienced in modernizing legacy on-premise products. Demonstrated strong initiative by volunteering for additional tasks, such as peer review, legacy product analysis, cost reduction strategies, automation script creation, and more.

nodes.title: Teaching Assistant @ T.U. Cluj-Napoca
nodes.body: As a lecturer of the Software Design laboratory for 3rd year computer science students, I developed my own teaching materials based on a flexible curriculum and evaluated student progress throughout the semester. I also graded their final exams to determine their overall performance in the course.

nodes.title: Co-Founder @ KickIT
nodes.body: As a co-founder of a start-up, I was responsible for legal, financial, and administrative tasks. Our company operated in the outdoor sports industry and suffered loss of customers during the COVID crisis. I designed, built, and managed a cloud-native progressive web application using React and Spring Boot, deployed on AWS Elastic Beanstalk, focusing on a great user experience, a smooth continuous deployment pipeline, and robust monitoring and observability setup.

nodes.title: Lead Software Engineer @ msg-systems
nodes.body: Served as a full-time employee with a versatile range of responsibilities including architecture, technical leadership, development, coaching, mentoring, hiring, training, and sales. My expertise includes SAP, Spring, NodeJS, React, and AWS, and I was recognized as an "SAP Developer Hero". As a leader, I managed teams of up to 10 people utilizing agile methodologies such as Scrum and Kanban. We successfully delivered several SaaS solutions used by thousands of users.

metadata.title: Șerban's Portfolio
metadata.description: Portfolio of IT projects built by Șerban Petrescu
metadata.name: Șerban Petrescu
metadata.role: SVP of Software Engineering | Cloud Architect
metadata.summary:
Hi! I'm Serban, an IT professional with a passion for code. I work full time as an SVP of Engineering at Trilogy, taught Software Design at TU-CN and founded a local tech start-up.

I lead an engineering organization of 30-40 people building full-stack products across diverse domains: Unity games, mobile apps, cloud platforms, and Salesforce extensions. I manage the complete engineering lifecycle—hiring (writing JDs, designing assessments, interviewing), architectural reviews and specifications, quarterly budget management ($6M/year), performance management, code reviews, and strategic planning with C-level executives on pricing, cost optimization, and portfolio evolution. I still write code regularly.

I have frequently switched between technologies, becoming proficient in TypeScript, Java, NodeJS, Spring, React, Unity and the SAP ecosystem. My current target area of expertise is around Amazon Web Services, AI/ML integration and cloud-native architectures.

education.title: Software Engineering MSc.
education.description: Master's degree at the faculty of Mathematics and Informatics, Babeș-Bolyai University (dissertation pending).

work.title: SVP of Software Engineering
work.description: Leading a 30-40 engineer organization building full-stack products across Unity games, mobile apps, cloud platforms, and Salesforce extensions.

nodes.name: BrainLift Coach
nodes.description:
An AI-powered knowledge curation and coaching platform that helps users build and maintain expertise through personalized learning paths.

Features an activity recognition system that analyzes user work patterns and maps them to relevant learning content using LLM analysis. Implements a sophisticated lesson management system with automated assignment reviews and progression tracking.

Uses Google OAuth 2.0 authentication integrated with WorkSmart API, and includes content suggestion pipelines that generate insights from meeting transcripts, user activities, and expert content sources. Built on AWS infrastructure with SQS message queuing for scalable processing.

images.description: Training dashboard showing the BrainLift learning journey with 27 structured lessons organized into courses like 'Foundations & Setup', displaying progress tracking with total lessons, completion status, and time invested.

BrainLift detail view for a DevContainer development environment topic, featuring AI-generated relevant topics, time tracking analytics (49m weekly total, 5m daily average), and integration options for Live Coaching Extension and Read.ai for meeting insights.

nodes.name: EduCRM
nodes.description:
A comprehensive admissions, enrollment, and Student Information System (SIS) for Alpha School and sister schools, managing the complete student lifecycle from initial inquiry through enrollment and rostering.

Built as an integrated ecosystem centered on HubSpot with custom middleware services. Handles lead capture, application processing with Stripe payment integration via custom PayGate service, shadow day scheduling, offer management, and deposit collection with Maxio subscriptions.

Serves multiple Alpha School brands and supports various enrollment types including full-time students, ancillary programs, camps, and marketing events. Integrates with learning platforms like Dash, TimeBack, and CoachBot for post-enrollment student management.

nodes.name: TimeBack App
nodes.description:
An educational monitoring and analytics platform deployed at Alpha schools that combines AI-powered surveillance and real-time coaching to enhance student learning.

Built as a desktop Electron application that captures screen content and face/gaze data to create a comprehensive view of student engagement. Supports 50+ learning platforms through a vision-first approach without complex API integrations.

Features include real-time AI analysis and feedback, privacy-conscious design, standardized learning analytics via 1EdTech Caliper, and integration with Alpha's learning ecosystem. The system provides teachers visibility into student engagement that was previously impossible in online learning environments.

images.description: App launcher interface displaying tiles for multiple learning platforms (AlphaMath Fluency with fact grid tracker, Athena, Duolingo, Math Academy, TeachTales, TrashCat) with preview screenshots of each app's content.

Waste Dashboard analytics showing 'No Waste' time (4hr 9m) vs 'Wasted Time' (2hr 23m, 58%), identifying biggest waste type as 'L4: On-Device Distractions' with detailed bar chart breakdown across multiple days.

nodes.name: TrashCat
nodes.description:
An educational gaming platform that combines engaging Unity gameplay with research-backed spaced repetition algorithms to build mathematical fluency.

As SVP, I served as both Product Manager and backend developer, designing and implementing the sophisticated learning algorithms that track individual fact mastery through seven sequential learning stages with dynamic difficulty adjustment.

The game follows a cat navigating obstacles home by solving mathematical puzzles, supporting multiplication, addition, subtraction, and division aligned with Common Core standards. Built on AWS serverless architecture with a few hundred active users.

images.description: Main menu showing the cat character, Practice/Speedrun mode selection, and progress bars for four math operations (Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication at 22%, Division).

Active gameplay with the cat running through city streets, dodging obstacles (dogs), answering multiplication questions (2 x 10 = ?), with a detailed mastery tracking grid showing progress across different factor groups.
Rewards screen displaying overall progress (22%) with individual multiplication fact families (x0's, x1's, x10's, x5's, x2's) showing Building Speed and Fluency levels with claimable rewards.

nodes.name: Athena
nodes.description:
An AI-powered comprehensive AP course learning and SAT prep platform designed specifically for homeschoolers, offering personalized learning experiences at approximately $1k per student.

Leverages the CoachBot Platform for core functionality including curriculum, user progress tracking, authentication, and AI-generated content. Features AI-generated video lessons, interactive quizzes, free response questions (FRQ) for skills assessment, and AI tutor support.

Built on AWS serverless architecture using AppSync (GraphQL), Lambda, Cognito, and RDS PostgreSQL with persistent caching. Targets homeschoolers in ESA states with mastery-based progression and adaptive learning powered by CoachBot's algorithms.

images.description: Course dashboard for 3rd Grade Math showing Unit 1 (Multiplication) with expandable lessons like 'Understanding Multiplication With Groups' (+15 XP), Next Up panel, and Start Lesson button.
Learning interface displaying the multiplication lesson with clear objectives and visual explanations using colored dots in groups (3 × 5 = 15) with progress tracking at 17%.
Practice quiz showing visual multiplication problem with circles containing blue dots, asking students to complete the equation '__ × 4 = 20' with Submit button and help options.

nodes.name: Reading Critters
nodes.description:
A mobile application designed to help young children learn to read through personalized, AI-generated content tailored to their reading levels and interests.

Features engaging lessons with tasks, steps, letters, words, and stories. Includes speech synthesis via ElevenlabsAPI and speech recognition capabilities. Uses OpenAI API for evaluating user responses and providing feedback.

Built natively for iOS using SwiftUI, with integration to Apple's learning analytics frameworks. Implements a vision to help students "read what they love, before they love to read" through dynamically generated unlimited reading content that incorporates student interests.

images.description: Letter tracing interface for teaching handwriting with the letter 'S', showing proper stroke formation with guide lines, and a cute cat mascot character at the top.
Interactive lessons teaching letters, words, and reading skills with the cute critter mascots guiding young learners.

nodes.name: ProductMind
nodes.description:
A platform that converts and organizes files from Google Drive, Notion, and other sources into a comprehensive, searchable knowledge base for Trilogy's M&A due diligence process.

Leverages AI-powered conversion tools (Claude, OpenAI GPT-4) to transform various file types into searchable Markdown format. Integrates with AWS Bedrock to provide AI-powered question answering over the aggregated knowledge base.

Built on AWS serverless architecture using Lambda, DynamoDB, S3, and Step Functions. Features automated file conversion pipelines, metadata extraction, and centralized knowledge management for analyzing acquired company codebases and documentation.

nodes.name: TimeBack Platform
nodes.description:
A 1EdTech compliant backend platform focused on OneRoster Rostering and Caliper Analytics standards, providing the infrastructure for TimeBack and other learning applications.

Built on AWS serverless architecture using API Gateway, Lambda, and RDS PostgreSQL. Features comprehensive modules for user management, authentication, event tracking, curriculum management, and analytics integration with QuickSight.

Serves as the central data layer for Alpha's learning ecosystem, handling rostering data and learning analytics for multiple schools and applications.

nodes.name: CoachBot Platform
nodes.description:
An educational platform at the core of Trilogy's data-driven, AI-powered approach to highly adaptive, personalized learning. Tracks student activity and progress across various learning apps and generates customized recommendations.

Features comprehensive modules including AI-generated content, adaptive learning recommendations, skills stack tracking, mastery calculations, and quiz generation. Supports multiple learning apps including TeachTower and TeachTap, as well as external platforms like Alpha School.

Implements sophisticated algorithms for personalized learning paths, reward systems, antipattern detection, and analytics integration with AWS QuickSight. Built on AWS serverless infrastructure with extensive curriculum management aligned to educational standards.

nodes.name: Crossover Hiring Platform
nodes.description:
Led the engineering team building and operating Crossover's global hiring platform, processing tens of thousands of applications monthly from hundreds of thousands of visitors.

Deeply involved in implementing AI-powered features including automatic AI grading of assessments, AI-based candidate screening and matching, and various AI automations throughout the hiring funnel.

The platform handles the complete hiring lifecycle from sourcing and application processing to assessment management and candidate experience across multiple channels.

nodes.name: Magic Academy (TeachTower)
nodes.description:
An innovative 3D Minecraft-like educational environment designed to gamify the learning experience for students. Visualizes a student's skill stack as interactive blocks in a virtual tower, where each block represents a skill or concept the student has learned or is mastering.

Built with Unity as a multiplayer 3D game integrating with the CoachBot Platform for curriculum management and AI-generated educational content. Featured gameplay modules including combat, pets, avatar customization, multiplayer interactions, and in-app purchases.

The game allowed players to earn diamonds by completing challenges and MCQs, redeem them for real-world prizes, and included premium membership features. Project was discontinued before launch despite significant technical development.

images.description: Multiplayer environment with player avatars gathered in a scenic outdoor area featuring a lake and natural landscape, with 'Team Up with Friends to Complete Quests' overlay.

Knight character with sword and shield standing before a tall skill tower built from colored blocks (yellow to green gradient), representing mastered learning objectives, with 'Build Your Magic Tower' text.
Math challenge dialog showing an NPC and a mental addition word problem (John has 590 balloons, buys 100 more) with multiple choice answers, overlaid with 'Solve Math Challenges to Level Up' text.

nodes.name: TeachTales
nodes.description:
An educational application that allows students in grades 2-6 to practice reading and comprehension skills through highly engaging AI-generated stories tailored to their choices, grade level, and reading proficiency.

Students create and shape their own stories through interactive choices, making reading a fun and magical experience. Features automated content generation with comprehension tracking, progress monitoring, and story sharing capabilities.

Built with React web and mobile apps backed by AWS serverless infrastructure (Lambda, RDS MySQL). Deployed using AWS CDK with automated database migrations and static data seeding.

images.description: Story reading interface showing 'The Underwater Match' with AI-generated illustration of underwater basketball featuring the Hulk, alongside comprehension assessment with multiple-choice guiding questions.

'What Happens Next?' branching choice interface allowing students to shape the story's direction by selecting from three dramatic options (Stealthy Route, Thorough Reconnaissance, Direct Assault), with quiz accuracy feedback showing 100%.

Story text and comprehension question interface showing continued narrative with embedded assessment asking 'What did The Hulk and Percy do to change the game's outcome?' with multiple choice answers.

nodes.name: TeachTap
nodes.description:
A "TikTok for education" mobile app designed to help high school students prepare for AP exams and SATs through engaging, personalized, AI-generated content. Featured on Dr. Phil and reached thousands of users before being discontinued due to commercial viability concerns.

Featured AI-animated historical figures as teachers, offering interactive lessons in a scrollable TikTok-style interface with gamified progress tracking. Students could engage in conversations with AI teachers, ask questions, and receive personalized responses.

Built with React Native for cross-platform mobile deployment, integrated with CoachBot Platform for curriculum and progress tracking. Used AWS AppSync (GraphQL), Lambda, RDS MySQL, and Cognito. Notable for its innovative approach to making test prep engaging through AI-powered interactive historical personalities.

images.description: AI-animated historical figure (Isaac Newton in period costume) teaching in TikTok-style vertical video format with 'AI POWERED TEACHERS' branding, showing interactive educational content cards.

Scrollable content feed displaying multiple AP World History topics (Latin American independence movements, mercantilism) in card format with 'FULLY MASTER ANY TOPIC' overlay, showing the diverse educational content library.

nodes.name: TSI Self-Serve Portal
nodes.description:
A self-service subscription management platform enabling Trilogy customers to independently manage renewals, invoices, and account information without sales representative intervention.

Built on top of Salesforce and integrated with Oracle NetSuite/SuiteBilling for billing operations. Features extensive AI automations to streamline subscription renewals and customer interactions, including automated contract renewal workflows.

The system handles both SaaS and non-SaaS products across Trilogy's portfolio, reducing operational costs for low-value ARR subscriptions while improving customer experience.

nodes.name: Foly Sites
nodes.description:
I built from scratch a couple of static websites for my wife: a personal travel blog and an interior design presentation site. They are hosted using serverless AWS services.

The content of the sites can be maintained by her using Netlify CMS.

nodes.name: InsideSales: PlayBooks
nodes.description:
A recently acquired Sales Engagement platform with a micro-service architecture, written in a heterogenous mix of Golang, Rust, NodeJS and PHP, with a React UI and running on AWS.

I have been coordinating multiple parallel tracks including: replacing parts of the system with SaaS offerings, lifting and shifting some of the servers from their data center to AWS, fixing high priority defects, stabilizing and monitoring the product, etc.

nodes.name: ResponseTek SSO
nodes.description:
Guided a small development team to enhance our customer feedback platform with SSO (Single Sign On) capabilities, by adding OAuth and SAML2 support.

I analyzed the existing code base, derived the architecture, designed the solution and organized the engineering work to ensure the project's success.

nodes.name: Financial Insights
nodes.description:
We've set up and consumed the AWS Cost and Usage reports to break down and scrutinize the cost structure for an AWS organization generating over 20M USD in yearly costs.

The insights that we found were then implemented as automation and pushed into QuickSight and Google Sheets to be consumed by top executives.

nodes.name: Architecture Spec Work
nodes.description:
My main responsibility is to write detailed technical architecture specifications for a portfolio 200+ products. I write about three specs per week, each requiring up to a few hundred man-days to implement.

Most specs extensively use AWS (AppSync, Lambda, DynamoDB, Cognito, etc.) but sometimes we also tackle changes to legacy, monolithic, on-premise products.

nodes.name: Cost Optimization
nodes.description:
I've performed extensive analysis on more than 500 AWS accounts to find cost reduction opportunities.

This involved writing a suite of Lambdas that periodically queried the target accounts for metrics and even executed some strategies (resource deletion, installing agents, etc.).

nodes.name: msg.Check-In
nodes.description:
A Spring Boot application with a Semantic UI React frontend for managing which colleagues are coming at the office in which days and in which room / place.

Currently, this product is being sold using a SaaS model, with the option of on-premise deployment on request. The SaaS version runs on AWS (CloudFront, Load Balancer, ECS, RDS).

images.description: The dashboard, which shows my future check-ins.
The map of a floor in one of our buildings.
The check-in flow allows checking in your team members as well.
The high-level, cloud-native architecture of the product.

nodes.name: Practical Dev Guide
nodes.description:
A YouTube series dedicated to teaching basic web application programming for students.

I am showcasing step-by-step how to build a typical Spring Boot application, backed by an embedded H2 database and fronted by a React user interface.

nodes.name: DIPKO
nodes.description:
I was initially the architect and lead developer for building a cloud-based, multi-tenant SaaS platform for managing municipal services. In 2021, I served as an occasional consultant for the team.

We implemented a modular NodeJS core, communicating with several serverless micro-services and a monolithic Angular frontend application.

images.description: The fully-customizable landing page of a tenant.
The list of bath houses enrolled in the tenant's account.
The administration view allowing tenant admins to customize each module of the site.
The checkout page which was integrated with several German payment providers.

nodes.name: Invoice Generator (II)
nodes.description:
A micro-service architecture web application built for the Service oriented architecture master course.

It is a re-implementation of the older invoice generator it using Spring, Mithril, NodeJS and Docker.

images.description: The list of companies managed by the application.
A list of invoices for a selected company.
The form for creating a new invoice.

nodes.name: msg.CareerStart
nodes.description:
msg.CareerStart is the de-facto flagship internship programme of the company's local branch. It was primarily based on an idea of mine.

I was the main organizer, a technical mentor and an interviewer for the first edition. We mentored eight students that built a three tier application using ABAP, Spring Boot, and Angular. Afterward, most of these students were offered permanent positions at the company.

images.description: The detailed schedule of the 7-week-long pre-employment program, organized in SCRUM Sprints.
The architecture of the solution implemented by the interns.
The domain model of the solution implemented by the interns.

nodes.name: Simple Q&A
nodes.description:
A micro-service architecture web application built for the Service oriented architecture master course.

It consisted of several NodeJS micro-services, a Zuul API Gateway, a simplified OAuth 2.0 authorization server and a React user interface.

images.description: The list of questions.
A form for asking a new question.
The detail view for a question, showing the votes and the answers.
The user is able to get notifications via email or via Web Push.

nodes.name: Software Design Lab
nodes.description:
I've hosted the Software Design laboratory for a group of students at T.U. Cluj Napoca.

I prepared my own learning resources and recorded our sessions in which we explored various architectural styles, design patterns and technologies (mostly Spring and React).

nodes.name: GDPR Integration
nodes.description:
A small integration project on AWS for handling newsletter subscription and un-subscription actions to conform to GDPR.

I designed and fully implemented this solution directly on the customer's AWS account.

images.description: The architecture of the setup including the lambdas and queues for handling failures.

nodes.name: Troubleshooting Service
nodes.description:
A small integration project on AWS for parsing XML exports from a legacy system. It consisted of a micro-service and a Lambda triggered by the S3 events.

I played the role of solution architect, designing and aligning the interfaces of the components, whilst the implementation itself was tackled by other developers.

images.description: The architecture of the setup including the lambda and the micro-service.

nodes.name: Conference Feedback
nodes.description:
A small application for submitting feedback after or during the IT Conference on SAP Technologies Cluj.

Later on, I have also hosted a small training about cloud native development using this application as an example.

images.description: During the conference, the feedback was automatically analyzed and displayed on a TV.

nodes.name: Kindergarten Game
nodes.description:
A simple story-like game for kindergarten children based on the "La Polul Nord" story by Marin Sorescu.

I built it for the Design of interactive software systems master course, the challenge being that the UI must be suitable for usage by four-year-olds.

images.description: A level of the game where you must collect clothing items.

nodes.name: KickIT
nodes.description:
Co-founder for a Romanian startup, KickIT, targeting the amateur soccer scene.

I was responsible for architecture, design, implementation and operations for the cloud-native solution, consisting of a Spring Boot backend, Lambdas and a React PWA deployed on AWS.

images.description: The home page of the application, showing the feed, PWA install prompt and upcoming events.
The screen for organizing a new match, showing the proposed time, the weather and how many people are coming.
The application can be used to organize soccer competitions (championships, tournaments, etc.).

nodes.name: Travel Expenses
nodes.description:
A project for our internal finance department to help them manage travel expense reports, calculate allowances and track business trips for our colleagues.

I acted as technical mentor and product owner for the fairly large team of developers assigned to this project.

images.description: The application provides several functionalities and also a configuration UI.
Most of the functionalities revolve around the employees, whose data may be imported from the HCM system.
Trip details may be added and viewed.
At the end of a trip, expenses may be reported and a settlement document is generated.

nodes.name: SAPIM
nodes.description:
SAP API Manager command line interface which can be used to deploy, create and remove API Proxies.

I built this CLI in my spare time to help the development process in SCP projects.

nodes.name: GSA: Common Services
nodes.description:
Architect and lead developer for building a suite of reusable micro-services supporting business applications for a market-leading manufacturing company.

I've had a major role in guiding our customer through various architectural decisions, whilst also implementing the most technically challenging components.

images.description: The architecture of the micro-services and surrounding components (components managed by our team in blue).

nodes.name: Insurance as a service
nodes.description:
A continuation of the "Next Generation Underwriting" project, but focused more towards cloud enablement. The project consists of several smaller prototypes or showcases that aim to be deployed on a cloud platform (e.g. AWS).

I had mostly development-related tasks related to building a MEAN stack solution.

nodes.name: msg.CareerPaths
nodes.description:
A series of technical trainings primarily for entry level developers and colleagues that wanted to shift technologies. The target technologies are: Spring Boot, NodeJS, React, Angular and AWS.

I was responsible for preparing the training materials, presenting them, doing live demos, regularly checking in with the trainees and finally reviewing their work.

images.description: We organized the trainings into "Career Paths", guiding our engineers through sequences of trainings.
Each step in a Career Path would have several chapters, organized in a branching journey.

nodes.name: UI5 JSX
nodes.description: Babel plugin for transpiling inline JSX into UI5 render functions. It enables very easy custom control creation by simplifying the render process.

nodes.name: UI5 Auth
nodes.description:
Lightweight open-source UI5 library which enables developers to build user interfaces which adapt at runtime to user roles.

The main goal of this library was to decouple the responsibilities of regular UI5 applications: role-based adaptation should be done declaratively and centrally for each app.

nodes.name: UI5 Viz
nodes.description: A simple open-source UI5 library for displaying graph data. I built it using a D3 force graph layout.

images.description: A graph derived from the metadata of an OData service.
A graph showing the data of the same OData service.

nodes.name: Candidate Management
nodes.description:
An internal project for managing our entry-level job candidates. The project was built using Spring Boot and a PostgreSQL database, with React on the front-end.

My role was that of a technical mentor, organizer and product owner.

nodes.name: Next Generation Underwriting
nodes.description:
Project focused on aiding underwriters in their work through predictive analytics and pre-built business rules.

My role in this project was a combination of a solutions architect, development lead and full stack developer.

We were a relatively small team of five developers and we built a series of Java and UI5 MVPs over the span of a year.

images.description: The user could define questions to build an underwriting questionnaire.
The answers from the questions would be used to compute further attributes using formulas.
All these results would be fed into a ML algorithm during the underwriting process.

nodes.name: My Portfolio
nodes.description:
This very website, which is meant to showcase my experience and projects.

Initially built with vanilla UI5, then re-built with custom controls using JSX, finally re-built again using React.

images.description: The first UI5 version of the site.
The later re-write using JSX and Bulma.
The current version of the website.

nodes.name: GTFE Analysis Reports
nodes.description:
A customer add-on to FS-RI (Financial Services - Reinsurance) for the General Reinsurance Company.

The add-on consisted of several UI5 applications which pulled various performance indicators calculated by ABAP CDS views and exposed through SAP Gateway OData services.

nodes.name: SBWO
nodes.description:
A Java standalone application, with an embedded web server and embedded database. The application aims to help small business to store, manage and use their business data.

I have built this project as an exercise in implementing various mechanisms from scratch (user authentication, session management, scheduling, etc.) to enhance my skills.

nodes.name: Document Generator (Remake)
nodes.description: A remake of an older project, with MongoDB for storing the document templates, Apache Derby + JDBC for storing the various user, template and field configurations and an UI5 interface. The OpenOffice API was called directly from Java to generate the documents.

images.description: The field configuration view (allows the users to define custom field validations).
The document generation view. The users must fill in all defined fields with valid values.

nodes.name: EPM WebSocket
nodes.description: A small personal project which realized real-time communication between an ABAP based user interface (classic Dynpro), a UI5 interface hosted on the ABAP system and another UI5 interface hosted on SAP Cloud Platform.

images.description: A side-by-side comparison of the Dynpro and UI5 user interfaces.

nodes.name: Graphical IDE
nodes.description: An application which can be used to write imperative Java code by dragging and dropping functional blocks. The generated code can also be displayed inside the application, compiled and run. The front-end is done in UI5 and the back-end is built in Java.

images.description: The drag-and-drop area of the application. The functional blocks can be dragged from the menu strip on the right and properties of each block can be set using the Properties toolbox. Blocks can be moved and their contents explored.
The generated code area (corresponding to the previous schematic).
The console area after compiling and running the Java schematic (can be done using either buttons or console commands).

nodes.name: Hospital
nodes.description: Hospital appointment management cloud application realized with JPA and UI5. Real-time notifications were supported by using WebSocket communication between the clients and the cloud.

images.description: The appointment list as seen by a doctor.
The patients list as seen by a nurse or secretary. The opened dialog can be used to make a new appointment.
A real-time notification received by the doctor when one of his patients has arrived at the hospital.

nodes.name: Taxonomic Engine
nodes.description:
A SCP, HANA, UI5 project for the human resources industry. The main goal of the project was to automatically parse and classify candidates based on their CVs.

We had a small development team in which I was the technical lead under the guidance of a senior software architect.

images.description: The result obtained after parsing and analyzing the contents of my own CV.
The same results, but compared against the typical profile of a Java Developer (as deduced by the engine).

nodes.name: SMTA
nodes.description:
A shipment tracking application targeted at the transport insurance industry branch, consisting of two tracking device prototypes (Android, Arduino) which communicate with cloud services, which store the data, send out notifications and process the collected figures to expose analytical scenarios.

As this was my bachelor degree project, I've built it completely from scratch by myself.

images.description: The sensor maintenance application.
The real-time tracking application with a transport being currently selected.
The transport evolution comparison application (the user has selected to align the starts of the data series).
The overall statistics application output.

nodes.name: Ticket System
nodes.description:
A UI-only application for an online, web-based ticketing system. It has three types of users: 
            customers which may open support tickets, employees which must solve the tickets and managers 
            which can oversee the performance of the employees and must solve any customer complaints.

images.description: The view which displays a customer's previously opened tickets.
The view which shows an employee's unsolved tickets.
The employee performance statistics application for managers.

nodes.name: Web Paint
nodes.description: A UI5 app which uses FabricJS to allow the user to draw by drag-and-dropping shapes and import external pictures. The user can also resize, move and change the colors of the shapes, use undo-redo functionality, save or load drawing files and also to export to PNG.

images.description: The main drawing area of the application, with the shape palette on the top and the objects' properties on the left.

nodes.name: Bank
nodes.description: A small bank application on the cloud. Persistency was done with plain JDBC and the user interface with UI5. This application was later remade by using Hibernate, Spring and AngularJS.

images.description: The home page of admin users.
The customer details page with the account list at the bottom.
The activity log of a user.
The account list (remake).
The detail page for an account (remake).

nodes.name: Bookstore
nodes.description:
A small bookstore on the cloud. Is very similar to the bank applications, but the persistency was 
            done in XML files (stored in a Cloud Document Store) and the user also has the possibility of 
            generating reports in various formats (TXT, XML, CSV).

images.description: The home page of an admin user (notice the tiles for generating reports).

nodes.name: SAP FS-PM add-on
nodes.description: A small customer addition to the Financial Services - Policy Management SAP module.

nodes.name: Internship Apps
nodes.description: Several primary insurance small UI5 applications. All of them had SAP Gateway backend services, which exposed RFCs from standard modules. Most of the applications targeted the transport insurance segment and two of them targeted small goods primary insurance.

images.description: Using the bill creation application, the user can add several items to a new bill.
Then the user must either search for the customer (business partner) or create a new one.
At the end, the user must agree to the terms and conditions. A PDF receipt is created afterwards.

nodes.name: Job Registry
nodes.description: This project was built in my spare time for a land surveyor. Using it, one can keep track of all jobs and related court terms. It offers a calendar for seeing court dates and automatically reads data from the Ministry of Justice Web API and the National Agency for Cadaster website to update the data.

images.description: The job registry. Each line represents a job. The user can search through the jobs, add a new one, sort them, edit, delete or expand a job to see further attributes.
An expanded job, showing the data retrieved from the Agency's website (the last row).
A fast entry screen, which can be used to enter the inquiry number for a job (after it was given to the Agency).
A fast entry screen, which can be used to change the status of a job.
The court terms calendar.

nodes.name: msg.LRM
nodes.description:
Various customer development projects centered on the Life Reinsurance Module.

I was part of the product development team for a few months to get acquainted to the module and the underlying framework. Afterwards, I worked on customization projects for large enterprise customers.

nodes.name: Assembly Graph Plotter
nodes.description: A mathematical functions graph plotting application entirely written in assembly. The user is able to enter the mathematical formula in the console and then the program plots the function's graph.

images.description: The formula entry console prompt sequence.
The resulting graph plot.

nodes.name: Invoice Generator
nodes.description: This is an application built on top of OpenOffice which can be used to manage invoices for a small company. It allows the user to define multiple profiles, it keeps track of customer data and generates OpenOffice invoices using a user-defined template. Receipts may also be generated from an existing invoice.

images.description: The profile creation / modification screen.

The main screen. Allows the user to enter various data related to the invoice, to save, restore, print or even create a receipt for the invoice (opens a separate application). A summary of all invoices can also be generated.
A demo invoice generated by the program.
A demo invoice summary also generated by the program.
The receipt data entry screen (fields are auto-filled if the receipt is derived from an invoice).
A demo receipt generated by the program.

nodes.name: Document Generator
nodes.description: A application for land surveyors built on top of OpenOffice, which takes input values from the user and optionally an XML data file and generates documents using user specified templates. The values given by the user or read from the XML are either filled directly in the templates or are used to build tables and hide / show sections.

images.description: The static input fields of the generator.
The file selection, template selection and the input field for the optional XML file.
The output of the generator.

nodes.name: Server Manager
nodes.description: A program specifically designed to manage dedicated servers for Mount and Blade: Warband. It allowed the simultaneous management of several servers, checking the logs, creating reports, scheduling start, stop or restart actions.

images.description: The first screen of the program. Allows the user to add or remove servers, to view the current status or to edit configurations.
The redirected console of the selected server (both input and output).
The event scheduler for the selected server.
The event log for a server.

nodes.name: Swadian Roleplay Mod
nodes.description: A Mount and Blade: Warband mod which aimed to completely change the game concept without forcing players to download anything. For this project, I was the sole developer. It consisted of modified Python scripts which were run by the server, PHP sites, C / C++ log parsers.

nodes.name: TrashCat
nodes.description:
An educational gaming platform that combines engaging Unity gameplay with research-backed spaced repetition algorithms to build mathematical fluency.

As SVP, I served as both Product Manager and backend developer, designing and implementing the sophisticated learning algorithms that track individual fact mastery through seven sequential learning stages with dynamic difficulty adjustment.

The game follows a cat navigating obstacles home by solving mathematical puzzles, supporting multiplication, addition, subtraction, and division aligned with Common Core standards. Built on AWS serverless architecture with a few hundred active users.

images.description: Main menu showing the cat character, Practice/Speedrun mode selection, and progress bars for four math operations (Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication at 22%, Division).

Active gameplay with the cat running through city streets, dodging obstacles (dogs), answering multiplication questions (2 x 10 = ?), with a detailed mastery tracking grid showing progress across different factor groups.
Rewards screen displaying overall progress (22%) with individual multiplication fact families (x0's, x1's, x10's, x5's, x2's) showing Building Speed and Fluency levels with claimable rewards.

nodes.name: Crossover Hiring Platform
nodes.description:
Led the engineering team building and operating Crossover's global hiring platform, processing tens of thousands of applications monthly from hundreds of thousands of visitors.

Deeply involved in implementing AI-powered features including automatic AI grading of assessments, AI-based candidate screening and matching, and various AI automations throughout the hiring funnel.

The platform handles the complete hiring lifecycle from sourcing and application processing to assessment management and candidate experience across multiple channels.

nodes.name: InsideSales: PlayBooks
nodes.description:
A recently acquired Sales Engagement platform with a micro-service architecture, written in a heterogenous mix of Golang, Rust, NodeJS and PHP, with a React UI and running on AWS.

I have been coordinating multiple parallel tracks including: replacing parts of the system with SaaS offerings, lifting and shifting some of the servers from their data center to AWS, fixing high priority defects, stabilizing and monitoring the product, etc.
